snippet: When the National Baseball Hall of Fame voting results are revealed Wednesday, it’s possible that no players on the ballot will have received the support needed for induction.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column fears that when National Baseball Hall of Fame voting results are revealed, it’s possible that no players on ballot will have received support needed for induction; says If indeed no players are elected this week, writers, and unwieldy election process will become the story, rather than candidates, and their on-field worthiness for enshrinement.
lead_paragraph: When the National Baseball Hall of Fame voting results are revealed Wednesday, it’s possible that no players on the ballot will have received the support needed for induction.

headline.seo: Baseball Hall of Fame Voting Unfairly Tainted by Steroids
headline.main: Steroid Era Suspicions Have Unfairly Tainted All
headline.print_headline: Steroid Era Suspicions Have Unfairly Tainted All
